newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Small grocer's shop under threat in Portugal - study.
newsitem.headline: Small grocer's shop under threat in Portugal - study.

text.p: About a third of Portugal's small grocer's shops are expected to close down by 2000 as big retailers take an increasingly dominant market share, according to a study published in Publico newspaper.
The study by consultants A.C. Nielsen said some 10,000 groceries were expected to close in Portugal by 2000, leaving them with just 7.5 percent of the market.

The Portuguese Trade Confederation, representing small businesses, has estimated that 60,000 jobs have been lost in traditional small shops in the past decade as huge shopping malls offering parking facilities and more choice of goods take an increasing market share.
